title: Measles Outbreak Plagues Europe’s Young Adults
text:
With measles outbreaks continuing to rise as the summer travel season heats up, WSJ’s Lorie Hirose takes a look at state vaccination laws and what the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is doing to fight the disease. Photo Illustration: Laura Kammermann

Finn McLoughlin, a 20-year-old Briton, didn’t receive a measles vaccine as a child because his mother believed there could be fatal complications from vaccines.

Today, he’s in no rush to get the shot. “I don’t get sick more than anyone else, and I don’t see the point in doing it,” the property manager said.

Measles “wasn’t that bad. We are...
quotes: I don’t get sick more than anyone else, and I don’t see the point in doing it,
